website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay a bit more, but this model offers a very sharp resolution and a large screen size.
pros: Amazing 37.5" screen size will provide a great viewing experience in a curved screen
Max resolution of 3840 x 1600 sits near the top of the market
Fast refresh rates are good for gaming
Side by side and picture in picture options
cons: Combinations with certain video cards may cause color accuracy oddities

customer_reviews.title: well-made and the display is beautiful. Very bright with great contrast
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is wide, well-made and the display is beautiful. Very bright with great contrast. No dead pixels, so quality control appears to be very good. The dimensions allow me to view three pages simultaneously without a problem, up to four pages if you want to fill the screen. Very happy I opted for this screen. I was looking at a number of different monitors--Dell, Asus, AOC, BenQ. They all had a number of features that I wanted, but none had the right combination. This monitor has a 75hz refresh rate and good enough resolution. Plus the 37.5" size is fantastic. I don't think a 35" would have made me as happy.
customer_reviews.author: the blue whale

customer_reviews.title: OMG this is ammmaaaazzzzing
customer_reviews.text: Not to big not to small just right! I did wish the resolution was a bit higher (I had 4/5k monitors before) but honestly I got used to it quickly. I was thinking that this would be good for using three apps side by side but realistically it's only good for two. I do use three often but I have them overlapping which is fine. I'm not a gamer so I can't tell you what that is like but for productivity this is a game changers. Spreadsheets, programming, music (DAWs look great in full screen!), video, graphic design are all wonderful with this monitor. The only thing that I can say that's bad, is I wish had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Get this over the LG 38uc99-w, it's the same IPS panel + cheaper!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this monitor. Its $200-300 cheaper than the LG 38uc99-w with the exact IPS panel. I have it connected through USB-C to my Macbook Pro 2016 which supplies a charge + video. I have confirmed the output wattage to Macbook Pro 2016 is 60W. I originally planned to buy the LG, but when I came across the Acer with the same panel at lower $300 price difference, 4 USB ports (compared to the 2 on LG), 3 year warranty (vs 1 year on LG), LED lightening, it was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with MacBook Pro 2016 for 4k@75Hz over USB-C
customer_reviews.text: The default monitor configuration gives 4k@30Hz over USB-C when I plugin my MacBook Pro 2016. Did research around, and found the way to enable 4k@75Hz over USB-C: Turn off the monitor's USB hub functionality. Go to Monitor Menu -> System -> USB 3.0 and turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I seriously love this monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this monitor. I used to have two wide screen monitors years ago but switched to simply using my MacBook Pro screen on my desk for the past few years. Do NOT know why I didn't buy something like this sooner. No longer feeling lower back pain because of looking down at my laptop for hours on end. The resolution is great - getting 60Hz at 3840x1600 via USB-C on my 2016 MBP 15-inch. (Be sure to switch off the USB-C hub capabilities in the monitor menu settings or it'll fall back to 30Hz.)
customer_reviews.author: D. Schmid

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Really the best ultrawide monitor available today. If you're used to 4k 27" monitors - the PPI on this monitor will be a little larger than you'd like, but still quite reasonable considering the size. The curve is perfect, not too flat like a lot of other curved ultrawides out there. The lights under the monitor are great at night - when on white, they provide a nice soft/subtle light for your entire desk. 75hz is great, I've read of a lot of people overclocking theirs to upwards of 100, but I wasn't able to with any success. It's a downgrade in hz from my previous predator, but an upgrade in every other aspect.
customer_reviews.author: LLOD

customer_reviews.title: Love it, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the same model panel as the high end LG monitor my boss bought me for my office workstation. I couldn’t handle going back to my laptop screen at home, and wanted the same desktop icon layout so bought this one to handle what is clearly a first-world problem. Was pleasantly surprised that this monitor cost less money than the same LG. For some reason I can’t explain, my MacBook Pro likes the USB interface for my peripherals on this more than the LG. Also the dimmable LED under-lights were a nice touch. And finally the monitor stand is 500% better than the LG.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Dow

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have been researching 38” monitors for a while. And it can down to this and the LG model. I. The end I went with the Acer and I’m glad I did. G-sync compatibly work excellent. Picture quality is really good. No light bleed and minimal ips glow. I had the smaller 34 950f and while I miss the 144hz its not a deal breaker in the least. 75hz is good enough for my skill level. If I have one complaint, the speakers are crap. But that’s typical of monitor speakers so I'm not going to ding the rating for it. System specs I9 9900k 64gb ram RTX 2080ti
customer_reviews.author: Gabe R

customer_reviews.title: better off getting a large 4K display/TV - it has similar width but you get more vertical landscape
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this. Overall the image and so on are fine. But I just didn't like the lack of vertical space compared to how much horizontal landscape it provides. I kept wanting to put things above or below items and there just wasn't screen there. It has same horizontal resolution has a 4k display but it lack a lot of the vertical landscape of the 4k display. So I've since bought a 4k TV instead of this and I much prefer it. I lose the minimal amount of freesync for more screen space really and better image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Visniewski

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor but the anti-glare coating is annoying
customer_reviews.text: For the price I was expecting a really great monitor for work. It's decent enough for videos or darker screens. But a lot of my work is in light colors or white backgrounds. The anti-glare is very noticeable and makes everything have a horrible haziness to it. When throwing on a video or something it's not real noticeable. That's probably my only complaint thus far, but is severely annoying enough to knock 2 stars off. It's really frustrating not getting a crisp clear image on anything that isn't colorful or dark.
customer_reviews.author: My Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Mac compatible
customer_reviews.text: Runs at full resolution on a Late 2013 Mac Pro at 75hz. Will run at 30hz on a 2010 Mac Pro with the ATI Radeon HD 5770. The stand kind of forces you to have the screen closer from the back of the table, FYI. So if your desk depth is on the smaller/shorter side, you may be finding yourself with the monitor closer to your face.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Co

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great monitor so far. I get no glare from the screen and it works awesome. I'm running from my computers display port and the image and sound quality are both good (sounds pretty good for monitor speakers). The USB bank in the back is great for charging and the adjustable stand is robust. When I first installed it I was using the integrated graphics from my pc. For some reason it didn't like that and the screen flickered with horizontal lines. I had a graphics card back ordered since a 2k ultra wide is a lot for integrated graphics anyway, and haven't had a problem since installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

Returning this monitor and buying something from LG or Dell.

customer_reviews.title: No windows 10 drivers
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful monitor, but unfortunately I will return it as it is not a fully compatible Windows 10. Acer only has drivers for Win 8 and earlier so you cannot get the refresh rate past 30 - the monitor is capable of 75. After speaking with ACER, they said no plans for that driver. So Windows 10 only see this as a Generic PNP monitor with a 30 refresh rate. This is also not mentioned in the ads for this monitor. Hooking it up was easy, the monitor itself is very sturdy and doesn't wobble at all. The speakers are nice, but a bit muffled being underneath. But noise free and sound great with headphones.
